meanings.definition: A red powder or cream used as a cosmetic for coloring the cheeks or lips.
meanings.sent1: She applied a touch of rouge to her cheeks before going out.
meanings.sent2: The actress wore rouge to enhance her natural beauty on stage.
meanings.sent3: The clown accidentally spilled rouge all over his face, creating a comical look.
meanings.sent4: The sunset painted the sky with hues of rouge, resembling a giant blush brush.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant rouge on her lips made her smile even more radiant.

meanings.definition: A dishonest or unprincipled person, especially a gambler or swindler.
meanings.sent1: The rouge at the poker table tried to bluff his way to victory.
meanings.sent2: Beware of the rouge who promises easy money but only brings trouble.
meanings.sent3: The rouge thought he could outsmart everyone, but his tricks were soon exposed.
meanings.sent4: His smile was as fake as a rouge's charm in a game of chance.
meanings.sent5: The rouge's deceitful ways caught up with him, leading to his downfall.

meanings.sent1: She carefully rouged her cheeks to add a rosy glow to her complexion.
meanings.sent2: The makeup artist rouged the model's lips for the photoshoot.
meanings.sent3: He playfully rouged his friend's nose with the cosmetic powder.
meanings.sent4: The artist rouged the canvas with bold strokes of red, creating a striking contrast.
meanings.sent5: The flowers in the garden rouged the landscape with their vibrant colors.

meanings.sent1: He tried to rouge his way out of the situation by telling lies.
meanings.sent2: The scammer rouged unsuspecting victims with false promises of wealth.
meanings.sent3: She rouged her resume to make herself seem more qualified for the job.
meanings.sent4: The con artist rouged his words with charm to manipulate others.
meanings.sent5: The politician rouged the truth to gain more support from the public.
